Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Looking at Event 1 to 3: The temperature starts at 20°C, then 20, 21. Pressure is steady at 1 bar. Vibration is 0 Hz, material flow is 0, tool position is 0, and energy consumption is low (0.4-0.5 kWh). These seem like idle states because all parameters are low and stable. The machine isn't doing much here.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Then Event 4 comes in: Temperature jumps to 50°C, vibration goes up to 30 Hz, material flow increases to 5 units/s, tool position moves to 5mm, and energy consumption doubles to 2 kWh. This looks like the start of an active phase. The increase in temperature and vibration could indicate some mechanical action starting. Maybe cutting metal? Because cutting usually involves high friction which generates heat and vibration.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Events 5-6 continue this trend: Temp rises to 55-58°C, pressure slightly up to 1.5 bar, vibration increases to 35-38 Hz, tool position moves further (7-10mm), and energy goes up to 2.5-3 kWh. Material flow stays at 5 units/s. This seems like the peak of the cutting operation where the machine is actively processing material. High temp and vibration support this idea.

Name: Pattern Recognition - IND
Text: Event 7-8: Temperature drops to 40°C, pressure increases to 2 bar, vibration drops to 10 Hz, material flow decreases to 2 units/s, tool position is now at 15mm. Energy goes down to 2 kWh. Maybe a different activity here. The lower vibration but higher pressure might indicate a pressing or assembling step where parts are being joined under pressure but with less movement.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Event 9: Temp spikes to 80°C, vibration jumps to 50 Hz, material flow stops (0), tool position remains at 15mm, and energy consumption shoots up to 5 kWh. High temp and vibration with no material flow—this could be welding or another high-energy process that doesn't require moving material but needs intense heat. Welding often requires high temperatures and might not involve material flowing during the process.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Event 10: Temp drops sharply to 30°C, pressure back to 1 bar, vibration very low (1 Hz), material flow still zero. Energy drops to 1 kWh. This might be a cooldown phase after welding. The machine isn't active here; maybe it's waiting or resetting.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Events 11-12: Temp stabilizes around 25°C, pressure remains low at 1 bar, slight vibration (5 Hz), material flow at 1 unit/s, tool position moves to 20mm, energy around 1.5-1.6 kWh. This could be packaging or moving parts after welding. The low energy and moderate flow suggest moving materials into packaging without heavy processing.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Finally, Events 13-15 return to initial low values: temp back to ~20°C, all other parameters low again—returning to idle state.
